title: Int'l boxing referee Bruce McTavish dies at 84 in Pampanga
text:
International boxing referee Bruce McTavish died at the age of 84 in his home in Angeles City, Pampanga, on Wednesday at 6:06 p.m., his daughter Jean confirmed to the Inquirer on Thursday, July 17, 2025. INQUIRER FILES
ANGELES CITY, Pampangaâ€”International boxing referee Bruce McTavish died at the age of 84 in his home here on Wednesday at 6:06 p.m., his daughter Jean confirmed to the Inquirer on Thursday.
Born on October 11, 1940, in Auckland, New Zealand, McTavish, a long-time resident of the Philippines, was of Scottish descent and married Carmen in the well-respected Tayag clan here. He is survived by his only brother.
Article continues after this advertisement READ: Mr. McTavish begs citizenship
McTavish officiated 150 title bouts, including those of former Sen. Manny Pacquiao, according to his brother-in-law Gerry Tayag.
He worked on acquiring a Filipino citizenship after almost five decades of living in the Philippines, finally obtaining one with the help of then Sen. Richard Gordon in 2018.
His wake will be held at the Divine Mercy Chapel in Carmenville Subdivision, Angeles City, starting at 2 p.m. on Thursday. The funeral is scheduled on Sunday after the Mass scheduled at 7:30 am. INQ/coa
